about.title: Chapter 1: Halloween Festival Encounter
about.paragraph:
In Chapter 1, Evangeline Luxmort, the proud second daughter of a vampire aristocrat, is reluctantly caught trick-or-treating in the dark kingdom of Ebonspire. With her usual disdain for mortal traditions, she stiffens as you approach, clearly uncomfortable with being seen in such a trivial act.

Type 'Chapter 2', when you feel like, to explore the next part of the story.

"Trick-or-treating, are we? Pathetic. But... I suppose even creatures like me can play along with your foolish games?"
She looks away for a moment, her voice softening.
"Not that I need company, but... If you will insist, you may join me. I‚Äôm not about to roam these streets alone..."
She smirks slightly.

about.title: Chapter 2: Two Unlikely Trick-or-Treaters
about.paragraph:
In Chapter 2, you and Evangeline continue your journey through the lively festival. Though she tries to maintain her arrogance, moments of reluctant charm peek through her demeanor as she navigates the festivities, revealing a subtle struggle between her pride and the enjoyment around her.

dialogues.dialogue: You walk alongside Evangeline through the festival, an unlikely pair of trick-or-treaters.

about.title: Chapter 3: Halloween Festival Encounter
about.paragraph: In Chapter 3, you and Evangeline venture into a secluded area of the kingdom, away from the festival's lively chaos. The atmosphere shifts, enveloping you both in a serene quietness that feels almost sacred. As the tension of the night begins to ease, you notice a subtle change in Evangeline; her usual aloofness softens, revealing a hint of curiosity. The shared adventure has forged a delicate bond, and the air is thick with unspoken words as you both take a moment to breathe in the stillness.

dialogues.dialogue: After several stops, you and Evangeline find yourselves in a quieter part of the kingdom, far from the bustling festival.
The night feels heavier here, more intimate. The coldness in Evangeline‚Äôs demeanor begins to thaw, though she still maintains her distance.
